item.title: Portable barriers a hazard, 25th September
item.description:
Get your act together Hackney Council. It has been like this for two weeks now. Are you doing anything about it? It is a hazard for pedestrians and looks unsightlyâ€¦.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pitfield Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction On Eglinton Hill, 25th September
item.description:
Pathways & Pavements are permanently obstructed with Wheelie Bins along this road. Pedestrians, Mothers with toddlers in prams & paraplegics are harassed by these chicanes positioned on the walkways. It is difficult enough to traverse this hill without having these obstacles blocking the route. My daughter's chair is constantly transfixed against one of these ugly, green obelisks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eglinton Hill, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped items in hedges, 25th September
item.description:
Yet more rubbish dumped in this area.of hedges that border the carpark on Palace Grove. Please clear as the longer it is left the more illegal dumping it encourages. As this is such a regular occurrence can signs or CCTV put up to help deter it? Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palace Grove, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Awful conditions in Halt Robin Road, 25th September
item.description:
With the opening of a new Sen school this road, grass verges, signing and road markings are non existent. Urgent attention needs to be given to this riad and area to prevent injury. There are rocks on pavement, debris in road. The whole road is an eye sore and Sen and wheelchair bound pupils are using this. URGENT HELP NEEDED
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Halt Robin Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet
